parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "Spack",
  "details": {
    "scheduler": "Slurm",
    "scheduler_module": "slurm",
    "spack_version": "0.17.3",
    "spack_instance_name": "cpu",
    "spack_instance_dir": "/home/cm/shared/apps/spack/0.17.3/cpu",
    "system_name": "expanse",
    "intel_license_file": "40000@elprado.sdsc.edu:40200@elprado.sdsc.edu",
    "spack_package": "openmpi@4.1.3",
    "spack_compiler": "intel@19.1.1.217",
    "spack_variants": "~atomics~cuda~cxx~cxx_exceptions~gpfs~internal-hwloc~java+legacylaunchers+lustre~memchecker+pmi+pmix+romio~rsh~singularity+static+vt+wrapper-rpath cuda_arch=none fabrics=ucx schedulers=slurm",
    "spack_dependencies": "^lustre@2.12.8 ^slurm@21.08.8 ^rdma-core ^ucx@1.10.1/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' ucx@1.10.1 % gcc@8.5.0)",
    "spack_spec": "openmpi@4.1.3 % intel@19.1.1.217 ~atomics~cuda~cxx~cxx_exceptions~gpfs~internal-hwloc~java+legacylaunchers+lustre~memchecker+pmi+pmix+romio~rsh~singularity+static+vt+wrapper-rpath cuda_arch=none fabrics=ucx schedulers=slurm ^lustre@2.12.8 ^slurm@21.08.8 ^rdma-core ^ucx@1.10.1/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' ucx@1.10.1 % gcc@8.5.0)",
    "slurm_job_name": "openmpi@4.1.3",
    "slurm_account": "sdsc",
    "slurm_partition": "hotel",
    "slurm_nodes": 1,
    "slurm_tasks_per_node": 1,
    "slurm_cpus_per_task": 16,
    "slurm_memory": "32G",
    "slurm_time": "00:30:00"
  }
}
```
This script uses Spack to install a specific version of the OpenMPI package with Intel compiler. It specifies several dependencies and configurations, including:

- **OpenMPI:** version 4.1.3
- **Compiler:** Intel compiler, version 19.1.1.217
- **Variants:** Disables atomics, cuda, gpfs, and enables cxx, cxx_exceptions, internal-hwloc, java, legacylaunchers, lustre, memchecker, pmi, pmix, romio, rsh, singularity, static, vt, wrapper-rpath. Sets cuda_arch to none, fabrics to ucx, and schedulers to slurm.
- **Dependencies:** Lustre 2.12.8, Slurm 21.08.8, rdma-core, and a specific hash of Ucx 1.10.1 compiled with gcc 8.5.0.
- **Slurm job configuration:** Runs on a single node with 16 CPUs per task and 32GB memory, limited to 30 minutes.

The script also outputs the timestamp, Slurm job ID, MD5 sum of the script, and prints the environment variables before installing OpenMPI using Spack.
